thread.title: Bafta blast claims Kate Middleton isn't welcome at awards for fear of upstaging Hollywood stars
thread.title_full: Bafta blast claims Kate Middleton isn't welcome at awards for fear of upstaging Hollywood stars

author: Claire Rutter
title: Bafta blast claims Kate Middleton isn't welcome at awards for fear of upstaging Hollywood stars
text:
Bafta blast claims Kate Middleton isn't welcome at awards for fear of upstaging Hollywood stars The organisation hit out at sensational rumours of fears over the Duchess of Cambridge's attendance Share Kate Middleton at the BAFTAs 2011 (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
The 'Kate effect' is running out if the latest sensational claims are to be believed – that the Duchess of Cambridge isn't welcome at the upcoming Baftas. 
The organisation has confirmed that an invitation both to its president, Prince William and his wife, have been given despite claims that senior staff are allegedly concerned that mother-of-two Kate would upstage the star-studded guests expected to attend. 
A Bafta spokesperson told The Sun: “It is completely untrue that Bafta has suggested that our president attend on his own. We would be delighted to welcome Their Royal Highnesses any year they are able to attend.” 
Its statement comes amid the newspaper's claims that several sources had claimed that they want Prince William to come along without his wife for fear of the 35-year-old 'stealing the spotlight'. 
It would be the first time ever that anyone didn't want the Duchess to bring her 'Kate effect' on an event. 
“William has faced serious criticism from the film industry for missing the Baftas the last two years, despite being our president. Kate at the BAFTA Brits To Watch event (Photo: Getty) Kate arrives with Prince William and Prince Harry (Photo: WireImage) 
“As a result of that feedback, he made it clear he wants to go this year and even bring Kate. 
“It would be a real show of his commitment towards Bafta and create headlines around the world. 
“But it was then expressed by senior staff within Bafta that Kate’s attendance will totally distract from all the film stars there.” Bafta have blasted claims Kate isn't welcome at the awards (Photo: PA) Chinese President Xi Jinping and Kate Middleton attend a BAFTA presentation (Photo: Getty) 
It's been claimed that Bafta chief executive Amanda Berry is trying to resolve any misunderstanding with Kensington Palace. 
The star-studded event, with the likes of Naomie Harris, Amy Adams, Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling expected to be in attendance, will be hosted at the Royal Albert hall on February 12th. 
So far Kensington Palace have remained tight-lipped on whether the Royal couple will attend. Like us on Facebook
